title: User Reviews & Ratings - clonazepam oral
text: I suffered from panic attacks and depression. It all started about a year ago. I was out of work for 2 months on medical leave. I take the drug with 100mg of Zoloft daily and I am a new person. I only take .25mg in the morning and afternoon but it does it's job. The only side effect is once in awhile I get dizzy when I turn my head but I can live with that. I recommend this drug to anyon but only in small doses. When I was at the height of my depression and close to being hospitalized, I was on 2mg and it really effected my motor skills. I was also on Lerezapam for anxiety and sleep. You take one pill and 20 minutes you are sleeping very soundly. Nothing could wake you. Very good drug while you are getting out of depression and anxiety

title: User Reviews & Ratings - Meridia oral
text: Responding to someone who wondered what would happen if they went off the drug. I used it to lose weight for my daughter's wedding but when I stopped taking it I kept exercising and eating right, and I at least maintained the weight loss of 21 pounds. I basically used it to jumpstart me at a point where I had plateaued. The wedding was 7 months ago and I have long since lost the commitment to my weight loss regime, and I did gain all but ten pounds back. Although I am exercising and dieting again I seem to be "stuck", so my doctor gave me a new prescription and I am hoping I will have good results again. To diet and exercise faithfully with zero results is discouraging. And, as my doctor explained, this drug was originally developed to treat depression, and the side effect was weight loss, so they started to market it for weight loss purposes instead. And so, an added benefit may be less depression, but who knows if that is a result of the drug or a result of looking in the mirror or having your clothes fit without cutting off your circulation. Whatever, it's a win win! Side effects were few. Constipation. But, as my gastroenterologist said, you can take Citruses

I have also had a lot of head aches and sleeplessness, it seams like i can't get enough sleep. I am taking COQ-10 but i don't seam to feel any better. Could anyone please tell me if these are lait symptoms of zocor

T3.text: symptoms of my legs, feet, toes,hands and ribs cramping

title: User Reviews & Ratings - clonazepam oral
text: I already have cronic depression and my family dr. finally got me to visit a psychiatrist. Was put on clonazepam for "generalized anxiety". Use to wake in the middle of the night with major butterflies from thoughts of work. now I don't have ANY butterflies and function much better at work. One thing though, just this morning I noticed my vision is very blurry even with my eye glasses on. My bi-focal aren't helping for clearer reading either. Seeing family dr. this morning and hopefully it's a temporary side effect because it's wonderful not feeling anxious any longer. (have had anxiety attacks

T5.text: wake in the middle of the night

title: User Reviews & Ratings - Crestor oral
text: Extremely high cholesterol not controlled by a combination of Lipitor & Niassan. Since being on Crestor for the past two years I eat what I want & no longer have high cholesterol

title: User Reviews & Ratings - clindamycin HCl oral
text: i have been on this med three times in the past few years for different infections and i have gotten some nasty side effects from it, but it does the job. it is a hard one to take. the first day or so i get a very high temp. and all the stomach problems after that, but it's nothing some acetaminophen

title: User Reviews & Ratings - Cymbalta oral
text: I had a severe allergic reaction, it started with my tongue feeling very sensitive & inflamed. I called my psychiatrist, not once BUT TWICE in 2 weeks! He told me to continue to "adjust". My symptoms got worse & worse, rapid heart beat, inability to think, extreme lightheadedness, sores in my mouth, sweating...it was HORRIBLE! After 3 weeks, one doctor thought I was having a heart attack & sent me to the emergency room.I almost died

title: User Reviews & Ratings - Cymbalta oral
text: I have taken Cymbalta for 2 months now. I am very happy with the results. I have tried many anti-depressants and find this very effective. My only complaints are that I feel nauseous most of the day, have irritable bowel syndrome, and extreme dry mouth. Those are symptoms I am willing to live with considering the alternative. I switched to Cymbalta from Effexor XR. The Effexor caused me to be tired ALL THE TIME, gain tons of weight, and still have aggression issues

title: User Reviews & Ratings - Zoloft oral
text: I started having anxiety which escaladed into panic attacks about 2 years ago. I started taking xanax as needed and then added .50mg of sertraline to that. I have been down great!I take .25 xanax at night to help me sleep. Down side I have gained at least 10 pounds

title: User Reviews & Ratings - Meridia oral
text: I have just started taking this medication a few days ago and so far no side effects. My appetite has decreased
